inputs.name: input_dir
inputs.description: The root folder of a input dataset. sub-* level folders should be here. If BIDS valid dataset (sub-XXXXX folders should be found at the top level in this folder).

inputs.name: output_dir
inputs.description: The output path for the outcomes of preprocessing and visual reports

inputs.name: analysis_level
inputs.description: Processing stage to be run, only "participant" in the case of QSIPrep (for now).

inputs.name: participant_label
inputs.description: A space delimited list of participant identifiers or a single identifier (the sub- prefix can be removed)

inputs.name: session_label
inputs.description: A space delimited list of session identifiers or a single identifier (the ses- prefix can be removed)

inputs.name: bids_filter_file
inputs.description: A JSON file describing custom BIDS input filters using PyBIDS. For further details, please check out https://fmriprep.readthedocs.io/en/0.23.0/faq.html#how-do-I-select-only-certain-files-to-be-input-to-fMRIPrep

inputs.name: bids_database_dir
inputs.description: Path to a PyBIDS database folder, for faster indexing (especially useful for large datasets). Will be created if not present.

inputs.name: nprocs
inputs.description: Maximum number of threads across all processes

inputs.name: omp_nthreads
inputs.description: Maximum number of threads per-process

inputs.name: mem
inputs.description: Upper bound memory limit for QSIPrep processes

inputs.name: low_mem
inputs.description: Attempt to reduce memory usage (will increase disk usage in working directory)

inputs.name: use_plugin
inputs.description: Nipype plugin configuration file

inputs.name: sloppy
inputs.description: Use low-quality tools for speed - TESTING ONLY

inputs.name: boilerplate_only
inputs.description: Generate boilerplate only

inputs.name: reports_only
inputs.description: Only generate reports, don't run workflows. This will only rerun report aggregation, not reportlet generation for specific nodes.

inputs.name: reports_output_level
inputs.description: Where should the html reports be writen? By default 'root' will write them ot the --output-dir. Other options will write them to subject or session directory

inputs.name: infant
inputs.description: configure pipelines to process infant brains.

inputs.name: package
inputs.description: Search PATH(s) for derivatives or atlas datasets. These may be provided as named folders (eg ``--datasets smriprep=/path/to/smriprep``).

inputs.name: b0_threshold
inputs.description: any value in the .bval file less than this will be considered a b=0 image. Current default threshold = 100; this threshold can be lowered or increased. Note, setting this too high can result in inaccurate results.

inputs.name: output_resolution
inputs.description: the isotropic voxel size in mm the data will be resampled to after preprocessing. If set to a lower value than the original voxel size, your data will be upsampled using BSpline interpolation.

inputs.name: fs_license_file
inputs.description: Path to FreeSurfer license key file. Get it (for free) by registering at https://surfer.nmr.mgh.harvard.edu/registration.html

inputs.name: recon_spec
inputs.description: json file specifying a reconstruction pipeline to be run after preprocessing.

inputs.name: input_type
inputs.description: Specify the pipeline that was used to create the specified input_dir.

inputs.name: fs_subjects_dir
inputs.description: Directory containing FreeSurfer outputs. FreeSurfer must already be run.

inputs.name: skip_odf_reports
inputs.description: Only run ODF reconstruction. Assumes preprocessing reports are already complete.

inputs.name: atlases
inputs.description: Atlas to be applied to data

inputs.name: version
inputs.description: show program's version number and exit

inputs.name: verbose_count
inputs.description: Increases log verbosity for each occurrence, debug level is -vvv

inputs.name: work_dir
inputs.description: Path where intermediate results should be stored

inputs.name: resource_monitor
inputs.description: Enable Nipype's resource monitoring to keep track of memory and CPU usage

inputs.name: config_file
inputs.description: Use pre-generated configuration file. Values in file will be overridden by command-line arguments.

inputs.name: write_graph
inputs.description: Write workflow graph.

inputs.name: stop_on_first_crash
inputs.description: Force stopping on first crash, even if a work directory was specified.

inputs.name: notrack
inputs.description: Opt-out of sending tracking information of this run to the QSIPrep developers. This information helps to improve QSIPrep and provides an indicator of real world usage crucial for obtaining funding.

inputs.name: debug
inputs.description: Debug mode(s) to enable. 'all' is alias for all available modes.
